kite.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a light frame covered in coloured paper or plastic that you let fly in the air on the end of one or two long strings
kite.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a type of hawk (=bird that eats small animals)
kite.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to raise the cost of something
kite.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Soaring medical costs keep kiting up insurance premiums.
kite.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to obtain money using an illegal cheque
kite.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to make a suggestion, often an unusual one, to find out what people think of it
kite.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: He used his speech to fly a policy kite.
kite.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to write cheques for more than the amount in the related account
kite.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Members of the society had kited more than 8,000 checks in a single year.
kite.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: drug-related crimes, like kiting checks to buy drugs
